definition: to disperse a meeting/to adjourn/finished
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting

sentences.english: The House (ie Members of the House of Commons) rose at 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 下議院已於晚上10點鐘散會。

sentences.english: I asked Baobao, Tiantian and other little friends to come to my party.
sentences.chinese: 我請了寶寶，苦苦戰其他小朋友去到場我的死日散會。

sentences.english: The meeting over, we headmaster soon left the meeting-room.
sentences.chinese: 散會了，校長很快就離開了會談室。

sentences.english: The meeting was so boring that nearly everyone there was watching the clock.
sentences.chinese: 會議很枯燥，差不多人人都看鐘希望快點散會。

sentences.english: There being no further business, l declare the meeting closed.
sentences.chinese: 沒有再要討論的事了，我宣佈散會。

sentences.english: As the meeting broke up, the participants divided into smaller segments-twos and threes .
sentences.chinese: 散會後，與會者分成三三兩兩的小組。

sentences.english: He announced thending of the meeting before I could get in a word.
sentences.chinese: 沒等我插上一句話，他就宣佈散會了。

sentences.english: As soon as the legislature went home, I vetoed the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在州議會散會之後，我立即否決了這個法案。

sentences.english: More diversity reduces amount you can speculate with.
sentences.chinese: 分佈過散會減少你能用以投機的數量。

sentences.english: After the meeting, they parted company, never to see each other.
sentences.chinese: 散會後他們分了手，從此再也沒有見面。

sentences.english: Thanks for your contributions.  We can finish there.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝各位的意見，我們可以散會了。

sentences.english: The meeting over, our headmaster soon left the meeting room.
sentences.chinese: 散會了，校長很快就離開了會議室。

sentences.english: After the meeting, the people poured out in crowds.
sentences.chinese: 散會後，人們一羣一羣往外湧。

sentences.english: Let's take a walk after dinner.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們晚飯後散會步吧。

sentences.english: There ebeling no further business, l declare the meeting closed.
sentences.chinese: 沒有再要討論的事了，我宣佈散會。

National Police Agency (Japan)
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
abbr. for 聯合國大會|联合国大会[Lian2 he2 guo2 Da4 hui4], United Nations General Assembly/abbr. for 國立西南聯合大學|国立西南联合大学[Guo2 li4 Xi1 nan2 Lian2 he2 Da4 xue2], National Southwest Combined University
hearse
waiter/waitress
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
Taichung or Taizhong county in central Taiwan
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
Huwei town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
two-China (policy)
